30720.name: Finger Dinger Man
30720.description: Players take turns being either Finger Dinger Man or Super Slow Man.Depending on the card drawn, Finger Dinger Man is released down a ramp towards Super Slow Man. Buttons are pushed to fake out your opponent by both players. The winner gets a card. Object:To win the most Finger Dinger Man cards.

30721.name: Lingo Word Dice
30721.description:
Not to be confused with the Lingo games which are played with pegs, cards or scrabble-like tiles.

The 25 letter dice are placed at random into the spaces of the grid. The 12 scoring pegs are placed in the holes in the corners.

Players then take turns to think of words beginning with the letters showing on the tops of the dice in the grid & each time a player names an acceptable word they remove the appropriate die from the grid & keep it (for scoring at the end of the game).

The winner is the player with the highest number of points !

30722.name: The Game of Categories, Answers and Fun
30722.description: The object of the game is to fill in the spaces of the game sheet with answers that start with a designated letter and are associated with a specific category within the allotted time. This is very much like the game Scattergories that came a year before it.

30723.description: A children's game (Ages 4 - 8) in which players must match tiles of objects whose words sound very similar (in German).
30723.name: Die freche Sprech-Hexe

30724.name: Siege the Moment!
30724.description: A cardgame where players use collections of cards to attack and defend, themed around castle sieges. The first player to successfully attack three times wins. Designed for a 2002 competition to create a game based on siege attacks.

30725.description:
1962: The city of Montreal's population booms to over 1 million people, and the city stands on the verge of international recognition. By the conclusion of the next decade, Montreal will host both the World's Fair, and the Summer Olympics. In the present, Mayor Jean Drapeau recognizes the immediate need for mass transit, a subway system.

This Age of Steam expansion puts players in the role of government planners, building the Metro, and transporting passengers on the island of Montreal. Unique features present in this map include neutral track (Government Links) and a new split level Locomotive, to take advantage of that track. Montreal was designed with the explicit, and sole goal of supporting the 3 player scale, and has several changes to enhance the play for that number of players. It is intended for experienced Age of Steam players.
30725.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Montréal Métro
boardgamepodcastepisode: Heavy Cardboard Episode 44 – Age of Steam

30726.name: The Transformers Card Game
30726.description:
The Transformers Card Game consists of four games using a 36-card deck containing 18 Autobots and 18 Decepticons. The following are the four games that can be played and a brief summaryof each:

1.)The Transformers Truth Game: The object is to get rid of all your card by placing two, three or four cards on the table and declaring that they are all the same numbered card. If any opponent thinks you are bluffing then he declares this. The player than shows the cards. If the player lied than he takes all the cards. However, if he was telling the truth then the opponent takes all the cards.

2.)Robot Battle: This game is played like the game "War" where you want to be the one with all the cards at the end.

3.)The Transformers Brainpower: This is a matching game where all cards are placed face down on the table and then two cards are flipped. If they are the same, then the player takes the pair and goes again. However, if the cards are different then the players turn is over. The player with the greatest number of pairs wins.

4.)The Transformers Shout: In this game, each player flips over cards one at a time. When a card is duplicated, the first person to spot this and yell "transformers" gets all the cards on then table. This continues until one player has no cards. At that time, the player with the most cards is the winner.

30727.name: I.Q. Games: United States History
30727.description:
How well do you know your US History?

In this game, one player reads from a list of numbered clues on the back of a card while others try to guess the correct answer. You score five points for guessing after one clue and it declines to one point if all five clues are read. The last clue is a picture of the place, event or person in question. Players continue taking turns until all cards have been read. Score is kept on included scorekeeper. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

30728.name: I.Q. Games: Wild Animals
30728.description:
How well can you identify wild animals?

In this game, one player reads from a list of numbered clues on the back of a card while others try to guess the correct answer. You score five points for guessing after one clue and it declines to one point if all five clues are read. The last clue is a picture of the animal in question. Players continue taking turns until all cards have been read. Score is kept on included scorekeeper. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

30729.name: Helmsman: The Game of Table Top Sailing
30729.description: Helmsman The Game of Table Top Sailing Made in England by Minimodels LTD. The object of this game is for two or more players to complete the sailing course on the board by fair sailing and superior skill thereby beating your opponents.

30730.name: Beat the Bookie
30730.description: Beat the Bookie published by Chad Valley/Barclay Toys from London in 1965. Game features a four foot long mechanical track, a game betting board and 5 metal "horses". Turning a crank on the game board moves the horses down the track and eventually produces a winning horse.

30731.name: Football Widows Game
30731.description: This 1980 game from Real Life Games from Oklahoma City, Oklahoma is really just a football gambling game. You use real life football games and then bet on which team will win and cover the spread. You are playing with play money. The game tells you to add up your total wins and loses and then either laugh or cry. Game comes with a supply of play money and a weekly score sheet to mark down how you are doing.

30732.name: Rund um den Kalender
30732.description: A children's game (Ages 4 - 7) in which players move around the board collecting cards representing the cycle of nature (the seasons). In the process they learn the days of the week and months of the year. A dexterity element occurs when one player must drop the four-seasons card and another player must quickly catch it.

30733.name: Mickey Mantle: Roger Maris Official Home Run Derby Game
30733.description: The baseball game is played by throwing Styrofoam balls at prongs contained within the target areas. Object was to have balls stick to the board in the HOME RUN area. The game comes with 3 Styrofoam balls and a small instruction sheet.

30734.name: Ein Song für Tom
30734.description:
Appears to be a companion card game to Freche Mädchen - Liebe, Jungs & Mädchenträume, also by Kosmos for the same gender and age group, based on the Sassy Girls, Sassy Books series. http://www.frechemaedchen.de/
The “Song for Tom” is set in the world of showbiz and music competitions. The players all have a crush on bitter-sweet Tom. Each player tries to form "girl groups" to win the contest first with a foursome, then a trio, and finally as a duo of musician cards. The first to complete a group receives a lucky stone as a reward. It takes three stones to win but heart-breaker Tom can appear at anytime to change the line-up.

30735.name: Official Mickey Mantle Baseball Action Game
30735.description: From Key Man; The box depicts a great picture of Mickey Mantle ready to swing the bat. The plastic toy is Approximately 7" long. Batter swings, and hits ball off standing tee when plunger is pushed.

30736.name: Win A Card
30736.description: Win-A-Card Board Game was put out by Milton Bradley in 1969 and came with 1968 Topps Baseball cards. Football and Non Sports cards were also included. The cards came in clear cellophane packs. The game box reads "Contains a generous supply.", probably between 50-70 baseball cards, and various amount of the other sports, and non sports cards. The 1968 Topps cards that were included with the game are of a different variation to the regular issued Topps cards. The backs of the cards are a bright yellow color as opposed to orange backs. Game included a spinner which was used to determine if trades of cards between players took place.

30737.name: Zahlen-Zauber
30737.description: Children's game (Ages 4 - 7) in which players move their fantasy character (fairy, dwarf, giant or wizard) through the Charm Forest looking for treasures. Each treasure is of a particular quantity (4 stars, 6 jewels, etc.). The player must correctly reveal the right number treasure in order to advance towards the castle. The first player to reach the castle wins.

30738.name: Ritter Kunibert im Zahlenland
30738.description: Children's game (Ages 4 - 7) in which players must help the good knight Kunibert catch the evil Zahlenteufel ("number devil") by solving simple math problems.

30739.name: Süße Jungs & Abenteuer
30739.description:
Freche Mädchen - Süße Jungs & Abenteuer: another in the
Freche Mädchen Freche Bücher or Sassy Girls, Sassy Books-related game series by Komos. This one is story-telling teen party game about their first teacher or the first boy with whom they were in love. Afterwards the player investigates the cover stories of the others.

30740.name: Jim Prentice Electric Whiz Raceway Game
30740.description: Jim Prentice Electric Whiz Raceway Game. Another Electric Game from Jim Prentice. This time the push button electronic connections determine which cars move on their trip around the track trying to win the race.

30741.name: Surf's Up, Dude!
30741.description: The game is for 2-6 players. The object of the game is to have as many surfers catch as many big waves as possible in the hopes of picking up more notoriety than the other surfers on the beach.

30743.description: Children's game (Ages 6 - 9) in which players take turns using the catapult to shoot cardboard tokens ("rocks") into the castle. If it lands in a section with a closed door, the player must correctly answer a "mystery" which tests their reading comprehension skills. Answering correctly awards the player the treasure in that room. The player with the most treasure wins.
30743.name: Rätsel in der Leseburg

30744.description: "Syllable King Castle" is a children's game (Ages 5 - 8) in which players must speak one-word answers to simple questions in order to get past doors on the game board. In addition to knowing the right answer, players must also indicate the syllables in the answer word by knocking on a door with a wooden stick. The first player to reach the top of the castle wins.
30744.name: Schloss Silbenstein

30745.description:
This is from the "Little Raven" game series based on the children's book series by author Nele Moost and illustrator Annet Rudolph. Alles Meins! is a children's game (Ages 4 - 12) in which players must keep track of the locations of different animals as they move around the game board in order to win tokens. It features "Small Raven": a popular character in German children's literature.

The little crow steals whatever toy is in front of him, but when he has taken all the toys from his friends, he realizes that this is not nice and gives all the toys back. This is a move and collect game.
30745.name: Alles meins!

boardgameimplementation: Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 2 – India & Switzerland
30746.description:
Officially an expansion that works with either Ticket to Ride or Ticket to Ride: Europe, Ticket to Ride: Switzerland requires the train pieces and train cards from the above mentioned original games to work. It comes with a new board, 46 new destination cards and a set of rules (in several languages) to create a new game. The Ticket to Ride: Switzerland map and rules first appeared as an exclusive map for the Ticket to Ride computer game. In addition to being specifically designed for a smaller numbers of players the map has several new features. Locomotive cards are used exclusively for tunnels (which work as they do in Ticket to Ride: Europe). Some destination cards have an end point inside Switzerland and other possible ends in adjacent countries (the value of the completed card is based on the farthest possible connection completed). There are also destination cards for connections between adjacent countries.

Although not officially sanctioned, it works fine with Ticket to Ride: Nordic Countries also. Due to Ticket to Ride: Märklin's different distribution of train cards, Ticket to Ride: Switzerland is not considered to be compatible.

Re-implemented / Re-printed in:

Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 2 – India & Switzerland
30746.name: Ticket to Ride: Switzerland
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGWS 014 – Ticket to Ride Europe, Switzerland and Märklin
Garrett's Games 90 - Ticket to Ride Swiss, Jungle Treasure, and Agricola...

30747.name: Spider's Web
30747.description:
Not to be confused with The Spiders Web from Otero Games.

Guide the spider around his web by tilting the board to control his scurrying movements. But beware ! If the spider passes over a hole he may stop in his tracks.

A tantalizing game teaching dexterity & co-ordination for any number of players from six years up !

30748.name: Jolly Roger Pirate Game
30748.description: Players spin a spinner to move their ship around a series of islands, racing to be the first to reach the home base.

30749.name: Zippy Zepps
30749.description: The game box shows a long Zeppelin air ship named ZZ1 and has the subtitle "Air Game". The two part board shows three cities inside large circles, Berlin, Paris and New York from left to right. Connecting the cities are curved, color paths, demarcated into spaces by crossing lines. The zeppelin pieces are made of metal. There are also cards showing zeppelins. The game was made to tie-in with the then new Transatlantic dirigible service

30750.name: Sprung aus den Wolken
30750.description: Based on a German television series of the same name around the time. Players were travelers parachuting into various adventurous locales such as making an accuracy jump, saving another skydiver by bringing him a parachute in freefall, firefighting as smoke jumpers, a demo jump before air force officers, incidentially saving one of them from drowning and finally saving some lost children.

30751.name: A Game of Insights: For Men Only
30751.description: This is a psychological-themed party game for men intended to have competitors explore their feelings, opinions, and awareness on variety of topics and personality areas. The game uses themes drawing from both Eastern and Western traditions of philosophy, etc. The game includes: 78 cards with illustrations, Playing board, Insights Into Action pad, and Guide to Keywords.

30752.name: Seattleopoly
30752.description: Seattleopoly is a Monopoly-style game which uses the theme of the city of Seattle, Washington (USA). Spaces on the gameboard represent well-known attractions, locations, and entities in Seattle. This game comes with: Playing Board, Surprise Cards, Treasure Cards, 2 Dice, Playing pieces, 25 Branch Offices, 15 Skyscrapers, Rules, and Money. The game was produced in connection with Seattle area charities.

30753.name: Auf und Ab!
30753.description:
"Up and Down" was originally published around 1920 by J.W.Spear & Sons. In 2006 Kosmos reprinted the game, including reproductions of the detailed, painted metal playing figures that were in the original game.

The game itself is a simple roll-and-move style game with squares on a circus background.

30754.name: Das große GEO-Quiz
30754.description:
This is a trivia game with over 1000 questions divided into five categories: Humanity, Earth, History, Technology, and Nature. Players move around the board trying to correctly answer questions so that they can earn chips from each area. The chips are used to surpass obstacles along the way, and players can rearrange the obstacles on the game board. The first player to reach the last square on the board wins.

There are several aspects of the game that make it family-friendly. The first is that questions can be answered in multiple-choice style so that players can try to deduce the answer rather than having to know the fact directly. The second is that there is a catch-up mechanism which boosts the player in last place so that they can compete more effectively.

30755.name: Journey to the North Pole
30755.description:
From the back of the box:

"Imagine strolling down Christmas Tree Lane... Prancing through Reindeer Pass... Gliding down Bobsled Run... Taking a jaunt across Jingle Bell Boulevard. All this and more await you as you journey along the pathway to the North Pole!

Santa has sent his elves into town on last minute errands. Each player must help his elf return to the North Pole, while enjoying holiday activities and collecting gift tokens in his own red gift sack."

This is a roll and move game where the object of the game is to collect the most gift tokens while moving to the end of the board. You have Instructional Spaces (where you complete a task to get tokens), Pictured Spaces (where you get a token), Location Spaces (where you get tokens), and Blank Spaces (where nothing happens). The person who gets the most gift tokens wins the game, and in case of a tie, the person who reached the last space first wins.

30756.name: Galaxy Xpress
30756.description:
Galaxy Xpress is a fun to play abstract card game for age 8+. Player, as the galaxy tour guide, will fly a luxury cruiser and take his tour to three designated planets for sightseeing. If the time is allowed, he will be more than happy to take the tour to sightseeing the natural phenomenon that occurs only once in every one millennium. During the trip, player may take the shortcut through space portal but be most beware of the Xnergy waste and the evil pirate. At the end of the game, the player with the most victory point wins.

Ages 8 and up

Player: 2 to 6

Time: 30 minutes

Contents (98 cards):
12 Planets
4 Events: 1 phenomenon, 2 portals and 1 pirate.
66 Xnergy in 6 colors
6 Tour Schedules
6 Luxury Cruisers
3 Phenomenon Tour Receipts
1 Comet. Starting player card

Creating the Galaxy:
In the middle of the table, randomly place 12 planet cards in a circular clock formation; 1 planet at every hour position. The circular formation is the ‘galaxy’. Then place four event cards next to 12, 3, 6 and 9 o’clock planets; phenomenon next to 12, pirate next to 6, and two portals next to 3 and 9. Event cards must be placed outside of the galaxy.

Goal of the Game:
When one player arrives home after a successful round trip, game continues until the round ends, and player with highest victory points wins.

30757.name: El hundimiento del Titanic
30757.description:
From The Publisher:

Be the first captain in sail your ship trough the icebergs. A funny game for the whole family

30758.description:
Sorceress Expansion Deck

As the Elven Nation reels under the Orc advance, a cry rings out for heroes. From ancient libraries hidden in the trees comes a Sorceress and her mystical companion. They pledge the full force of their arcane arts to the destruction of the Orc tide!

The Sorceress is a HeroCard expansion deck for HeroCard Orc Wars. The Sorceress can compete in any HeroCard game or can be combined with other decks to create a customized character.

Contains 33 character cards and 1 figure
30758.name: HeroCard Orc Wars Sorceress Expansion Deck

30759.description:
Ranger Expansion Deck

As destruction looms over the Elven Nation, a cry rings out for heroes to defend it. From the depths of the verdant forest a Ranger emerges. He pledges his twin blades and huntsman's prowess to fight the Orc scourge and carve a path to victory.

The Ranger is a HeroCard expansion deck for HeroCard Orc Wars. The Ranger can compete in any HeroCard game or can be combined with other decks to create a customized character.

Contains 33 character cards and 1 figure
30759.name: HeroCard Orc Wars Ranger Expansion Deck

30760.description:
It is a truth universally acknowledged that everybody loves seeing penguins sliding around on the ice. And soccer is the world's game, right? So take some cute families of penguins, give them an icy soccer field and a ball, and watch the slippery goodness that ensues. . .

Penguin Soccer is a game in the tradition of Chess, Checkers and Go. There are no dice, no cards, no random elements - only the skill of the two players. But instead of stern soldiers marching about a battlefield, or abstract stones on a grid, Penguin Soccer is about penguins sliding and spinning and chasing a soccer ball across a frozen field!

Games last up to 45 minutes (or use a chess clock at 15 minutes per player for Tournament-style play).

Originally designed in 2007 as a part of the Looney Pyramids Gaming System, Penguin Soccer was published commercially for the first time in February 2010 and is available direct from NestorGames Worldwide.

Free Android app (AI and multi-player) available from the Google Play Store.
Online Play


Super Duper Games
Jocly
30760.name: Penguin Soccer

30761.name: Kosmopoliya
30761.description:
Kosmopoliya is a Russian board game about space exploration, economy and warfare. The goal of the game is to gain a cosmic monopoly and be the last player on the board.

The game board shows a circle of planets. It is players task to start the economical development on the planets by establishing space ports, mines and factories. Players can do investments on several planets. Players also need to secure their economy by investing into space ships that can protect their convoys. Thus the game is about the balance of maintaining and moving of the their space ship fleet and at the same time developing the economy of planets to get more money. All attacks on planets are solved by throwing dice.

Zvezda game number for Kosmopoliya is 8608.

30762.description:
Mykerinos: The Nile

This Mykerinos add-on was made available at Essen 2007. It includes 6 new tiles and 4 tokens. The players will sail on the Nile and meet a new character, governor Greenwish.

Now also available in Ystari Box (Rio Grande Games edition only)
30762.name: Mykerinos: The Nile

30763.name: The Game of Yakima Washington
30763.description: This is a Monopoly-style game based on the businesses and community landmarks of the town of Yakimg, Washington (USA). Some variations in traditional Monopoly rules are present, including the use of a commodity-futures exchange.

30764.name: Farscape The Card Game
30764.description:
Card game based on the popular SCI-FI show Farscape. The object of the game is to have the highest score by the time the series (game) ends. There are Character cards, event cards, character exit cards and play change cards.
CHARACTERS in the game:
Pa'u Zotoh Zhaan - DelvianPriest
Aeryn Sun - Ex-PeaceKeeperCommando
Ka D'Argo - Luxan Warrior
Chiana - NebariThief
Dominar Rygel XVI - Hynerian Royalty
Commander John Crichton - HumanScientist
Captain Bilar Crais - PeaceKeeper Captain
Scorpius - PeaceKeeper Special Ops
SikozuSvalaSugaysiShanu - Kalish Biloid
Pilot - Pilot
Joolushko Tunay Hovalis - Interion Student
Utu-Noranti Pralatong - TraskanHerbologist
Stark - Banik Strykera
Jothee - Luxan Hybrid
Moya - Leviathan
Talyn - Leviathan Hybrid
Lieutenant Braca - PeaceKeeper Officer
Commandant Mele-On Grayza - PeaceKeeper Officer

Events are drawn from the event deck and have differing effects. When a characters Physical Health or Mental Health has been reduced to zero that character is out of the game. Their are also events that change rules of the game. (reverse direction, reduce hand size, play all cards on a turn not just one, hand size is increased from 5 to 7 and eventually the end of season card which ends the game.)

30765.name: Miro
30765.description:
From Games of Art, Miro is a game based on the artwork of Joan Miró.

The game board consists of a single curved line that loops over itself many times. Players color segments of this line to color in. When an area is enclosed, the player who acted scores points based on the number of enclosing segments he or she owns.

30768.description:
From the publisher: "Angelina can’t wait to be a ballerina
And dance in the big performance! But everything takes time and practice. Before she dances on center stage, she needs To learn her dance steps and collect all the
necessary items to be a prima Ballerina!"

While learning and performing steps along the way, players try to collect all the items necessary to take ballet classes for the big performance at the Royal Theater. The game features a dual number/color spinner so children who can't count yet can still play.
30768.name: Angelina Ballerina's Big Performance Game

30769.name: Penn Stateopoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
boardgameversion: Late for the Sky Production Company edition
30769.description: Monopoly type game designed for Alumni, students and friends of Penn State University, which uses locations, traditions, and features of the university and its athletic programs in place of the traditional Monopoly spaces and cards.

30770.name: Monopoly: Pittsburgh Steelers
30770.description: A Pittsburgh Steelers Collector's edition of Monopoly, Steeler fans can buy, sell,and trade the blackand gold's greatest players and team assets, including 4 coveted Super Bowls. 6 Collectible Pewter Tokens: Quarterback, Linebacker, football, cheerleader, and a Steeler's helmet and Whistle.

30771.description: 18West is an 18xx design by David G. D. Hecht, published in October 2007 by Deep Thought Games. 18West incorporates a variety of mechanisms into the 18xx framework, including three different types of companies (Granger roads, land grant and public) and subsidized track laying. Mergers are also involved, in which public companies can acquire Granger roads.
30771.name: 18West

30772.name: Scourge!:The Search for the Bloodkey
30772.description:
From the Publishers' website
"Scourge! is the first game in our line of Make-Your-Own games. When you receive your book cut it out and assemble it yourself and your ready to play. In the game af Scourge! you take on the role of a cult member bent on taking control after the mysterious death of your leader. Build an army of street thugs and demons and amass a library of spells to defeat your enemies while battling in the crowded alleys of a Victorian Metropolis."

30773.name: Green Goblin Game of Fractions
30773.description: This is an educational children's game intended to teach them fractions. Players compete to correctly identify fractions and fraction calculations while avoiding the "Green Goblin." Game includes a variety of cards with fractions and partial fractions, pie charts, and a green goblin.

30774.name: B.S. Degree Game
30774.description:
The object of B.S. Degree Game is to earn enough college credits (units) to graduate before any other players.

The board is laid out into four quadrants; Freshman, Sophomore, Junior and Senior years.

The playing time is approximately 1-2 hours for two players. Add additional 30-60 minutes for each additional player.

There are also instructions for using other trivia games in conjunction with this one.

30775.name: What's the Word
30775.description: Players put words to definitions to advance. Go from home to the library and back. Three different types of cards: Amateur, Intermediate, Expert. Several different definitions per word. 5 playing pieces are provided, and it is suggested that for more players people organize into groups.

30776.description:
At the beginning of the round, 4 cards with different numbers are revealed in a 2x2 pattern.
Each player has five two-faced cards with 4 numbers on each of them, and must use 4 of them to create, as quickly as possible, a 3x3 grid where each number is present once (just like in Sudoku) and the 2x2 pattern of numbers is present as well.
The quickest player wins the round - the winner of the game is the first player to win 3 rounds.
30776.name: Sudokarré

30777.name: Malhação: O Jogo
30777.description:
In "Malhação - O Jogo", players are challenged to answer correctly questions about... the other players! Each turn, a player reads out loud a card with a question, and secretly choses one out of three options about how he (or she) would react in such situation. After that, it's time for the others to try to guess which was the chosen answer.

The game always have two winners - each player has a separate score with every other player. In the end, the pair that has the highest sum of points wins the game.

30778.name: Monopoly: Lionel Postwar Era
30778.description: This is a version of the game Monopoly based on the theme of Lionel trains (postwar era). The game has custom money based on vintage Lionel Stock Certificates, Crossing Gate and Banjo Signal Cards, and 6 Collectible Pewter Engine Tokens.

30779.name: Monopoly: Hard Rock Cafe
30779.description: This is a version of Monopoly based on the restaurant chain of Hard Rock Cafes. The game includes 6 Custom Pewter Tokens (Hurricane Glass, Motorcycle, Hamburger, Guitar, Guitar Pick, and Saxaphone)

30780.name: Monopoly: United States Coast Guard
30780.description: This is a version of Monopoly based on the United States Coast Guard. Players can buy, sell and trade the U.S. Coast Guard’s most prized assets including Diamond Head Lighthouse, USCGC Juniper, and the HH-65 Dolphin in an effort to protect U.S. Homeland Security. Includes six collectible pewter tokens (Eagle, Life ring, Anchor, Cutter, Helicopter, and Lighthouse).

30781.name: Monopoly: Estes Express Lines 75th Anniversary
30781.description: This is a version of Monopoly themed on the 75th Anniversary of the Estes Express Lines trucking company.

30782.name: Monopoly: Chicago Bears
30782.description: This is a version of Monopoly themed on the National Football League (NFL) team the Chicago Bears. Players can buy and sell many of the team's most famous players, including Walter Payton and Brian Urlacher.

30783.name: Monopoly: Philadelphia Eagles
30783.description: This is a version of Monopoly based on the National Football League (NFL) team, the Philadelphia Eagles. Players can buy and trade the team's most famous players, including Ron Jaworski and Donovan McNabb.

30784.name: Monopoly: Sunterra
30784.description: This is a version of the Monopoly game based on the theme of vacation resorts, including the Sunterra resort. Players can buy, own, and trade some well known resort properties. Traditional houses and hotels are renamed Units and Resorts, and customized Sunterra themed SunOptions and Exchanges cards replace Chance and Community Chest cards. Includes 6 custom Pewter Tokens which include: Sunterra Flip Flops, Beach Chair, Golf Cart, Beach Cruiser, Jet, and Ski goggles.

30785.name: Monopoly: My Fantasy Baseball
30785.description: This is a version of Monopoly based on Major League Baseball Players. This version has a unique mechanism whereby the traditional property spaces start out blank and are filled with baseball players (over 100 players to choose from) as the game progresses and the game players "draft" their fantasy baseball team. The game includes 6 custom pewter pieces, including: the hot dog, the World Series Trophy, pitcher, batter, ball in glove and catcher’s mask.

30786.name: Monopoly: St. Louis Rams Champions Edition
30786.description: This is a version of Monopoly based on the National Football League (NFL) team the St. Louis Rams, and their championship season in 2000. The game was limited in production and each copy is individually numbered

30787.name: Monopoly: New York City
30787.description: This is a version of Monopoly based on landmarks and features of New York City. Includes 6 Custom pewter tokens (Horse & Carriage, Big Apple, I love NY, The New York Times, Statue of Liberty, Taxi Cab), The New York Times cards, New York Magazine cards, studios, and brownstones.

30788.description: This is a Monopoly style game based on the Red Deer Region of Alberta Canada. The game was produced in conjunction with Habitat for Humanity and its proceeds benefitted that organization.
30788.name: Red Deer on Board

30789.name: Monopoly: New York Jets Collector's Edition
30789.description: This is a version of the Monopoly game based on the National Footbal League (NFL) team, the New York Jets. Players can Buy, sell and trade the team's most valuable players, from Joe Namath and Mark Gastineau to Chad Pennington and Curtis Martin.

30790.name: Ant Ranch
30790.description:
(Taken from website)

Little Billy got an Ant Ranch for his birthday and sent away for entirely too many ants. You lead one of the unfortunate colonies trying to survive in your new plastic home. To win, you must battle the other ant colonies and survive the many perils, from handing responsibility of the ant ranch over to little brother Johnny (who loves playing with a magnifying glass!), to game's end, when Billy's mom gets fed up with the whole ordeal and throws everything in the trash. Whoever has the most ants when this occurs wins the game!

During your turn, you lay tiles to build the tunnel system your colony thrives in, or play special cards to harvest food and water so you can multiply faster than your opponents. Roll the action-packed aphid die and see what your outcome will be! 2-4 players can play Ant Ranch in 2-3 hours.

30791.name: The Republic
30791.description:
Welcome to Rome, circa 510BC. Following generations of tyrannical monarchy, the fledgling republic of Rome has become a political battleground for a few old and powerful families, each now vying for control and influence. As the city grows so do familial ambitions.

Change is inevitable and the Republic will soon fall, only to be replaced by an empire the likes of which the world has never seen... but a great empire needs an emperor of great conceit and wiles. With the rules, alliances, and strategies ever changing, it might not be who you think.

The Republic is a game of political intrigue and city building for three to six players. Although tile placement and economics are important considerations, the true focus of the game is on the politics. Each round, players are required to vote on laws that drastically alter the way the game is played, often affecting players in radically different ways. The winner of the game is usually the first player to collect a set amount of Imperium, a resource which can be earned through well-planned construction or lawmaking.

30792.description:
Adversaries was GDW's series of additional detailed game components (miniatures really) for the many titles under the Space:1889 Banner.


Martian Cloudships (GDW 1801)

A set of miniature plastic Martian cloudships. The box contains several additional sprues of the Martian Cloudships, identical to the single sprue contained in Sky Galleons of Mars. The true genius here was including kit bashing instructions so that avid players could convert these stock miniatures into other cloudships detailed in yet other Space: 1889 (Original edition) products.

Expands: Sky Galleons of Mars and Ironclads and Ether Flyers


Aerial Gunboats (GDW 1802)

A similar set of plastic British aerial gunboats. In this case, additional sprues of the British Gunboats from Sky Galleons of Mars with kit bashing instructions to create other gunboats detailed in Space: 1889 (Original edition).

Expands: Sky Galleons of Mars and Ironclads and Ether Flyers


Victorian Adventurers (GDW 1821)

A set of ten 25mm figures created by RAFM to replace the pawns in Temple of the Beastmen.

From the publisher:

Intrepid Victorian adventurers penetrate the inner sanctum of a High Martian kraag, the mountain fortresses cut from the living stone of tall mesas by the savage winged High Martians. Each adventurer strives to be the first to fight his way through to the heart of the kraag and discover the sinister Worm Priests.

Expands: Temple of the Beastmen, Soldier's Companion, and Cloudships & Gunboats


Kraag Warriors (GDW 1843)

A set of twenty 25mm figures (in 10 poses) created by RAFM for use with Temple of the Beastmen and the related role-playing game.

Expands: Temple of the Beastmen, Soldier's Companion, and Cloudships & Gunboats


Soldiers of the Queen (GDW 1841)

A set of eighteen 25mm figures (in 10 poses) created by RAFM for use with Soldier's Companion and the related role-playing game.

Expands: Soldier's Companion and Cloudships & Gunboats


Legions of Mars (GDW 1842)

A set of twenty 25mm figures (in 10 poses) created by RAFM for use with Soldier's Companion and the related role-playing game.

Expands: Soldier's Companion and Cloudships & Gunboats
30792.name: Space 1889 Adversaries
boardgamefamily: From RPG books to board games

30793.name: Burgerbattle
30793.description: Ketchup, mustard, pickles, peppers, mushrooms, onions, lettuce, tomato, bacon, cheese! Keep piling on the ingredients as you pass the burger around the table. When you can't resist any longer, put a top on it and make it your burger. But don't wait too long or someone else will grab it first.

boardgameimplementation: A Call to Arms: Babylon 5 Space Combat
30794.description:
Accompanying the brand new second edition of the award-winning A Call to Arms Babylon 5 space combat miniatures game, the Babylon 5 A Call to Arms 2nd Ed. Fleet Book contains the comprehensive data necessary to play any of the major and iconic racial fleets of the Babylon 5 universe. The Earth Alliance, Minbari Federation, Centauri Republic, Narn Regime and League of Non-Aligned Worlds have all their ship types and fleets described, along with their game statistics. Also included are fleet lists for the ancient Shadows and Vorlons, as well as expanded information on the fleets of specific League races, such as the Brakiri, the Vree, the Abbai, an other races like the Dilgar, Drakh and multi-racial Raiders.

Finally, there are brand new fleet lists added to the game with this book - the Gaim, pak'mar'ra and Psi Corps!

This is not a complete game and requires the Babylon 5: A Call to Arms (Second Edition)

A reimplementation of A Call to Arms: Babylon 5 Space Combat
30794.name: Babylon 5: A Call to Arms (Second Edition) – Fleet Lists

boardgameimplementation: A Call to Arms: Babylon 5 Space Combat
30795.description:
The eagerly-awaited second edition of the award-winning A Call to Arms Babylon 5 space combat miniatures game is finally arriving. Throughout the station’s turbulent history, armed fleets have enacted the harsher policies of their governments. Whether you wish to command an intrepid EarthForce Expeditionary Fleet, a high-tech Minbari taskforce or a cunning Centauri raider group, this rulebook provides you with up-to-date rules to play out your favourite Babylon 5 space battles... or take to the stars and create new legends in the dark.

The new edition has been carefully honed, based on the comments of A Call to Arms players all around the world - it is faster to play, more comprehensive and finely balanced to portray the very best of space combat in the Babylon 5 universe.

Inside the covers, you will find new rules for combat, hyperspace, placing Admirals on your ships and a completely revised system for Fighters. As always, scenarios and full campaign rules have been included, making this the most comprehensive release yet for the game.

This is a rulebook only, the complete fleet lists are in Babylon 5: A Call to Arms (Second Edition) – Fleet Lists

This is a reimplementation of A Call to Arms: Babylon 5 Space Combat
30795.name: Babylon 5: A Call to Arms (Second Edition)

30796.name: Dare Ya!
30796.description:
From the manufacturer:

Ok girls, you have been posting cool truths and dares to the Girl Tech website and now we have created the ultimate truth or dare game for you! Just spin to play and watch the cool lights display your next move, whether it is a Give, Take, Truth, Dare or Double Dare. And guess what, now you can record your very own double dares - you can make them as silly, gross or daring as you want! The Truth Detector let's you test your friends truthfulness. Collect a chip from each category to win the game!

* The ultimate Truth or Dare game
* Record four double dares of your own
* Truth Detector
* 500 Truth or Dare cards

Ages 8 and up

30797.name: Postcards from North America
30797.description: Postcards from America is a unique game where the players learn geography by traveling to cities and other locations based on actual postcards. The game used 64 postcards from the game designers personal travels. Designed for Ages 7 and up

30798.name: Easy Come Easy Go
30798.description:
Each player starts the game with 50,000 cash and pawns are placed on the start. Players then travel around the board (1 trip around equals 1 year) and attempts to collect CD's, Blue Star, Gold Mine, Oil Well, Real Estate, Mutual Fund cards in order to amass Bonus cards.

The first player to collect 5 Bonus cards wins the game.

30799.name: Admiral
30799.description:
The object of the game is to be the first player to attain the Admiral rank.

You start the game as a Midshipman (Naval Cadet) and get promoted to the next higher rank when you achieve the required points at the "Promotion Board".

Use a combination of "Naval Academy" cards and dice roll to help you meet the necessary points. Other players can attempt to sabotage your promotion by using "Top Secret" cards. However, these "Top Secret" cards, once used, are removed from the game, so the timing and frequency of use can be a factor.

ADMIRAL can be classified as a family game - providing enough element of luck for children to win yet offering light strategy play for adults to stay engaged.

30800.name: Spinespur
30800.description:
From Publisher's Website*


Spinespur is a world where evil reigns supreme and even the angels have stains on their wings. Spinespur is filled with the typical chainsaws, zombies, and werewolves as well as more obscure or innovative nightmares all its own. It’s a Modern Survival Horror game with elements of fantasy alongside elements of science fiction.

30801.name: Kampen om Örebro (Kunskapsspelet)
30801.description:
Kampen om Örebro is about the Swedish city Orebro. It is a game similar to monopoly with some extra rules such as questions about local company in örebro.

Kampen om Örebro belongs to a series of games called kunskapsspelet.

30802.name: Bicycle Moto Cross Challenge Action Game
30802.description:
"Cross Challenge" is unique. It will teach you HOW to actually race at any BMX track.

This game is designed for two, three, or four players and it never plays the same way twice. The competition is identical to racing in a real BMX moto. "Cross Challenge" is truly a game of skill, but, like any sport, luck also plays a part. Choose the command card you think will gain you the best position on the board/track and then experience true BMS racing excitement known as "Berm Warfare" (In Bicycle Motocross (BMX) bicycle racing and mountain biking (MTB), a berm refers to a banked turn made from dirt with a relatively tight radius)

boardgameimplementation: Advanced Song of Blades and Heroes
30804.description:
Song of Blades and Heroes is a fast-play, skirmish-level fantasy miniature system. It uses an action-point system that requires no book-keeping. The rules are designed to be simple, fast and fun so that a mini campaign of several games can be played in a single evening.

The game uses only 6 sided dice and requires approximately 5-10 models per player. The rules recommend 15 mm figures on a 60x60cm play area, but can be played in other scales. There is nothing scaled in inches or centimetres, three measuring sticks to measure all distances and ranges. Alternatively the game can be played without measuring sticks on a hexgrid.

The game includes statistics for 180+ monsters and heroes, and details to be able to create your own. Also there are campaign rules where your warband grows more powerful after every battle, and six basic scenarios.

There are some stand-alone games based on the same system, which could also be used as expansions to the base game:


Song of Arthur and Merlin (2008) - Arthurian supplement featuring sections on the historical Dark Ages king, the Welsh legendary king, and the Hollywood king. Originally an expansion, in 2011 this was re-released as a stand-alone product.
Mutants and Death Ray Guns (2008) - a post-holocaust skirmish game.
Song of the Splintered Lands (2009) - Sourcebook based on the Splintered Light miniatures line.
Song of Drums and Shakos (2009) - a Napoleonics skirmish game.
Flying Lead (2010) - a game of gang warfare to Pulp action, from military operations to black-clad assassins.
30804.name: Song of Blades and Heroes
boardgamepodcastepisode: I've Been Diced! episode 66: Combat systems
I've Been Diced! episode 72: Sam Mustafa and miniatures gaming galore

30805.name: The Five Wise Birds
30805.description: Five colorful birds from the island of Woozoo are sitting on a fence. Each player gets 6 shots per turn to knock them down. When a bird is hit, it flips over and a score is shown. The first player to 250 wins.

30806.name: State Geography
30806.description:
State Geography is a deck of cards featuring information about the 50 states of the United States of America. The game was published by AAA as a travel game.

The game includes rules for 5 different games that can be played with the cards:
State Memory Match
Go Travel
State Rummy
Wild World Six Draw
State War
The games are played by either looking at states that have contiguous borders or comparing information on the cards including population, total area and union entrance date.
The cards also include facts about each state and a map indicating where the state is in the union.

30807.name: BattleTech: Die Welt des 31. Jahrhunderts
30807.description:
Die Welt des 31. Jahrhunderts is the complete future-history of the BattleTech world. Authors Mai and Nick have taken every BattleTech product, including board games, novels, graphic novels, computer games, role-playing products, comic books, and the CCG to create an encyclopedia of every person, place, and event outlined. This book is profusely illustrated with many color plates and the book is over 500 pages long. Included are a complete timeline of the BattleTech Universe, complete listings of every BattleTech product in a variety of media, and a list of every BattleMech model in both English and German. The book sports a fantastic cover by Joern Rauser.

This book was published in German, and although there have been talks of an English translation, no such translation has yet appeared.

30808.description: Players dodge sharks and other dangers while trying to make their fortune in the South Seas.
30808.name: South Sea Adventures

30809.description:
The 18xx MSK 1 extension kit adds 6 new tiles for either the 1829 Northern Board or 1829 - 2 gray 'universal junction' tiles, and 4 '5-spoke' double-station city tiles that can promote any green station tile, with a half-page of rules for their use.

Expands:

1829
1829 Northern Board
30809.name: MSK 1 Extension Kit for 1829 (Northern & Southern Boards)

30810.description:
The 18xx MSK 2 Extension Kit for 1829 adds 9 additional trains - 3 x '3T', 2 x '6', 2 x '2+2', 2 x '4+4E' - to 1829 - either 1829 or 1829 Northern Board, with a half-page of rules for their use.

Expands:

1829
1829 Northern Board
30810.name: MSK 2 Extension Kit for 1829 (Southern & Northern boards)

30811.name: Nittany Lion Trivia
30811.description:
Contents: 1 playing board, one die, 250 question and answer cards, 25 directional cards, 4 player pawns and 16 scoring rings.

Players must correctly answer questions in each of the four categories when landing on the appropriate square. The player who answers all the categories first must then proceed to the Alumni house and answer one more question. The final question category is to be determined by the other players involved in the game. An exact roll is required before landing on the Alumni House. If the question is answered correctly the game ends.

30812.name: Gotta Second
30812.description:
The object of the game is to beat your opponent's time at a fun task. The fastest times score points. Be the first player to peg to the finish and you're the winner.

Contents of the game include a timer, timer arm, plastic tray, game board, 264 Gotta Second cards, 2 pads of paper and 12 game pegs (2 each of 6 different colors).

Game instructions are printed in English and French.

30813.name: Where Jesus Walked
30813.description:
Be one of Jesus’ disciples as you follow Him around Galilee and Judea. Learn about miracles, teaching, and famous journeys and where to find them in the Bible.

Beginning at Nazareth, players start out on a journey to other places on the map. As each place is visited an event card is taken from the pile which refers to an event in Jesus’ life which occurred at a certain place. The basic idea is to match up event cards with places visited.

Once you have visited 7 places and you have an event Card for each of those places, you immediately begin your journey to Jerusalem. On arrival you have one minute to memorize the information on your 7 cards. You score one point for each piece of information you remember, with a total of 3 points per card, making a maximum of 21 points. The winner is the one who ends the game with the highest score.

30814.name: Trees and Flowers
30814.description:
Flex your brainpower to collect matching sets of trees and flowers in the fast-paced fun of Trees and Flowers. Learn the names of 96 fascinating flowers and trees plus the geographic regions where they grow.

This card game consists of 12 sets of 4 cards each of similar categories of trees and flowers. The object of each game is to secure as many sets as possible. Skill in playing is acquired by remembering.

Ages 6 and up.

30815.name: Birds and Animals
30815.description:
Flex your brainpower to collect matching sets of birds and animals in the fast-paced game of Birds and Animals. Learn the names of 96 fascinating creatures plus the geographic regions where they live.

This card game consists of 12 sets of 4 cards each of similar categories of birds and animals. The object of each game is to secure as many sets as possible. Skill in playing is acquired by remembering.

Ages 6 and up.

30816.name: Miracles and Pitfalls
30816.description:
In Miracles and Pitfalls up to six players race around the board from the Start space to the Finish space, answering Bible questions from one of four different categories (Bible Characters, Places, Objects, and Fill in the Blanks). A player must correctly answer a question before having the opportunity to roll the die to move forward. Most of the spaces on the board correspond to one of the four categories, but some spaces allow a player to choose which category they want to answer a question from. Some spaces require a player to draw a "Miracle" card which will give the player some benefit like skipping ahead on the board, while other spaces require the player to draw a "Pitfall" card. These cards have negative effects like, for example, causing a player to lose a turn. There are spaces that allow players to take shortcuts along the path and other spaces that require a player to take a longer detour. Finally, there are slide spaces which allow a player to slide forward or backward one space to get to a category space that might make it easier for the player to answer the question. The box includes 800 questions, with 4 questions per card.

Ages 5 and up.

30817.name: Bible Bonanza
30817.description:
How well do you know your Bible? Do you know which book comes before Habakkuk? How many chapters are there in the book of Titus?

Bible Bonanza is a package of six Bible based card games that will test your knowledge of Biblical trivia. The included games are:

1. Bible Pairs
2. Bible Runs
3. Book Piles
4. Book Ends
5. Challenging Chapters
6. Impasse!

Ages 5 and up.

30818.name: Bible Scramble
30818.description:
Bible Scramble is a game that turns Bible trivia into lively entertainment. It is both a battle of wits and a race against time as players flip over cards and dig into the letter pile to spell out their answers to Bible trivia.

The object is to be the first person to spell out the answers to your card questions with letter tiles, and to clean your opponents out of shekels. Each card supplies a Bible text just in case memory fails.

Ages 10 and up.

30819.name: Crimson Sky Privateers
30819.description:
Card game for 2+ players.
Each player controls a squadron of Privateers.
The object of the game is to successfully lead your pilots on missions vs pirate gangs, enemy militias, and commercial zeppelins.

VICTORY Conditions
The player with the most VP (Victory Points) at the end of the game wins.
The game ends when a player goes to draw a card and there are no cards left in the deck.
VP are gained by completing missions.

Players share a common deck. That deck contains 6 types of cards: H = Pilots, P = Planes, W = Weapons, M=Maneuvers,
D = Damage, V = Missions

Game also uses two six sided dice
Counters are used to mark damage to the planes.


Each player is dealt 7 cards.
Roll high on 1D6 to see who goes first.

On ones turn the player goes through 6 phases;
Luck Phase
Recruit Phase
Mission Phase
Defender Phase
Action Phase
End Phase

Completing misions scores points Whoever at the end of the game has completed the most missions or who has destroyed aircraft who are attempting to complete a mission is the winner.

30820.name: Wind & Wetter
30820.description: In this each player tries to move his 9 pieces to the opposite site. On the board you have several terrain types you can cross or not depending on the weather conditions. But the players can change the weather.

30822.name: Piccolo Park
30822.description:
A Medley of 4 Music Games

Using cards, a spinner, a 3D gameboard and a cassette tape, children play 4 progressively harder games to learn about the orchestra. Pawns depict children playing various instruments, and games consist of activities like a race to see whose orchestra will be the first on stage. The cassette has a story on one side, with side two being sounds of instrument families - you must identify the strings, brasses, woodwinds and percussions. Games are aimed at children Ages 7 - 10

30823.name: Colossal Fossil Fight
30823.description: In Colossal Fossil Fight, each of the two players use a dinosaur to pick up bones from the bone yard and place them into their den. There are three types of bones (legs, ribs, and skulls) which are worth one, three, and five points, respectively. Once all the bones are removed from the bone yard, the player with the most bone points in their den is the winner.

30824.name: The Shirt Tales Game
30824.description: In The Shirt Tales Game, players choose to be there favorite Shirt Tales cartoon character and move around the three-dimensional board to collect their four shirt tokens. The first to collect their tokens and get to the top of the large oak tree is the winner.

30825.name: Qurush
30825.description:
Playable with any 16 dice (25 in a four-player game) and some pawns, Qurush is a quick abstract game where each player is attempting to rearrange the dice to match a secret pattern they design before the game begins.

Full rules (and downloadable "qubes") are available at the Invisible City Productions website:

http://www.invisible-city.com/play/303/qurush

30826.name: Turista Mexicano
30826.description:
This game, produced and sold in Mexico, is a clone of Monopoly. Dice are rolled, the airplane tokens are moved, states of Mexico (properties) are purchased, etc. There are also Mexican Train lines to buy, Lottery and Surprise cards to draw, as well as the famous "collect 200 pesos as you pass Go" space.
It also comes with plastic chips to play checkers with.

30827.name: Elementeo
30827.description:
Elementeo is an educational card game developed by Anshul Samar. Chemical elements can be combined to form compounds that can be used in the game.

Homepage: http://www.elementeo.com

Description from the Maker:

In the Elementeo Chemistry Card Game (v1), elements have their own personalities -- Oxygen becomes Oxygen Life-Giver, Sodium becomes Sodium Dragon, and Iodine becomes Iodine Mermaid. Players can create compounds and play with element in the game. Elementeo includes five different levels (element, reaction, compound, alchemy, and fusion) and has elements, compounds, and alchemy cards (which include black holes and nuclear fusion). The goal of the game is to capture your opponent's electrons and reduce them to 0.

What People Have Said About The Elementeo Chemistry Card Game (v1):

"This young inventor has stumbled upon something that will stimulate minds and make people more interested in science” - Dr. Tom Lane, Past President, American Chemical Society.

"Elementeo teaches kids to see elements and compounds not as boring things to be memorized but as interesting personalities and powerful agents at work in the world. Which is of course exactly how real chemists and scientists see them. If they come away from the game remembering a fun fact about an element, or understanding the basic notions of bonding and charge, they will have a powerful head start in understanding chemistry" - Theodore Gray, co-founder of Wolfram Research (makers of Mathematica) and Popular Science columnist.

“Elementeo builds on games like Magic: The Gathering and Pokémon by appealing to kids with its fun factor, but also focusing on the education side. The world should take notice.” - Peter Adkison, CEO of Hidden City Games, and former CEO of Wizards of the Coast (the makers of Magic: The Gathering and distributors of Pokémon).

Update: The first version of Elementeo (v1) has sold out, the next version (v2) is expected to hit amazon.com in the beginning of summer 2012. Alchemist Empire, Inc also released an Elementeo App on the Apple App Store for students to explore the elements and create their own Elementeo elements.

30828.name: Sockeye
30828.description:
Sockeye follows the life-cycle of a Sockeye Salmon. It is designed to be a fun educational exploration of salmon information.

Players begin as salmon eggs which hatch into fry. The fry grow into fingerlings in a lake and then proceed to the ocean. This course is reversed as the salmon returns to the same spawning bed were it was born. Along the way there are many hazards to the growing salon; from river dangers to being eaten by animals and people.

The game is a standard roll-and-move variety. The frequent hazard spots move the player back or forward a number of spaces; make a player miss a turn; or require a particular number to be rolled before continuing. The last hazard, three spaces from the finish, is particularly nefarious as it sends the player all the way back to the beginning.

The game comes with a map of the Sockeye spawning rivers of BC Canada and a detailed description of the life-cycle of a Sockeye Salmon. The game artwork is beautiful, from the board to the fish-shaped playing pawns.

30829.description:
In Caterpiggily, players take turns drawing duel-colored tiles which represent sections of a caterpillars body, and placing the like colors next to each other thus building the caterpillar. Player continue around the table placing their tiles until one player has no more tiles to place. This player then places the head and is declared the winner.

User Summary:

A fun game for 4 to 12 year-olds where you match colors from you hand to form a caterpillar. The goal of the game is to be the first to place his or her last card thus having the privilege of placing the head of the caterpillar. Each player starts with 5 cards. Each card has two colors. Each player matches the color at the end of the caterpillar with the color on one of their cards. If they don't have the color they have to draw until they get it. If all of the cards run out and you still don't have the color you have to pass.
30829.name: Caterpiggily

30830.description:
War in Iraq
This Age of Steam expansion takes place in the desert of Iraq. The war has concluded, and lucrative oil fields have recently been discovered. Your goal is to ship the oil to the US and Europe to enrich your business. The US Army will, of course, aid your cause...

New York Subway
This Age of Steam expansion takes place in New York City, and you have to construct a subway beneath the skyscrapers. This map features innovative rules which drastically augment both the track building and goods shipment phases of the game.
30830.name: Age of Steam Expansion: War in Iraq & New York Subway

30831.name: Barbed Wire Bullets & Bayonets
30831.description: Fast play WW I skirmish rules. Ground scale is 1" = ten feet. Units are generally platoons; larger games involving many platoons may be done. Under ten pages of rules, plus several pages of charts. Information for tanks and artillery is included.

30832.name: Bazooka Bait
30832.description:
Fast play WW II rules scaled to actions from company to task force sized. General organizational information provided from platoons to battalions. Written from 15mm-25/28mm scale, but convertible to 5/6 mm if desired.

Less than seven pages of rules, plus some charts with numerous weapons and AFV values differentiated.

30833.name: The Wandering Merchant
30833.description:
In The Wandering Merchant, players play the roles of merchants buying and selling goods. They drive carts pulled by horses transporting them between small villages separated by dangerous wilderness areas in a fantasy setting. The goal is to be the first player to earn a fixed amount of money. Players can also upgrade their carts to transport more goods per trip or buy more horses to travel faster.

This game was an entry to the Good Portsmanship contest in March 2007, and it's based of Merchant of Venus by Richard Hamblen.

30834.description:
Six Gun Sound is THE cowboy game. Why? Because Six Gun Sound puts you into the Wild West of 1875 to 1885. Why did we pick that ten year period? Well it covers the Lincoln County War, the unpleasantness in Tombstone. The Demise of the James/Younger Gang, the gold fever in the Black Hills that led to the Great Sioux War of 76 as well as the founding of Deadwood, lots of Apache trouble, the Nez Perce, the flight of the Cheyenne from Indian Territory...and a bunch of other stuff.

We’re talking Billy the Kid, Pat Garrett, Wyatt Earp, Doc Holiday, Custer’s Last Stand, Geronimo, and Wild Bill Hickok to name a few. This is the time period that made the Wild West wild and burned it into the hearts and minds of every kid growing up. Except in Six Gun Sound we dig deeper into it to let you “live” the time period. How so? You choose what you want to be. Marshal, Outlaw, Ranger, there’s up to six different professions. So different that each one has a unique Encounter system that allows you fight the battles that these Gunfighters, Cowboys, and others would fight. What’s the “Encounter” system? It’s what tells you who, what, and when you’re going to meet when it’s fighting time. Now add this to the “Campaign” system and you’re not just gaming the Wild West, you’re living it!

With the “Campaign” system you can travel all across the US and into Canada or Old Mexico if you like. We’re talking about 22 different areas that you can travel through. Each one is rated by how “civilized” it is…or not. For example, so when you go through Indian Territory expect to find…you guessed it, Indians. All the work of dreaming up your next bank robbery, gunfight, cattle drive and many other encounters are already done. We’ve done all the work, we’ve built and populated your world, and all you have to do is enjoy and play the game!
30834.name: Six Gun Sound: Blaze of Glory!

30835.name: Shark!
30835.description:
The aim of the game is to get both your harpoons into the shark and tow him to one of the ports.

Play consists of rounds with players moving their boats and putting out the bait followed by the sharks move.

First the shark surfaces and then moves towards a boat where the shark tries to overturn the boat or the boat attempts to harpoon the shark

The game uses both spinners and Dice for movement and determining the outcome of actions.

30836.description: This is a twist on the old connect four game. The playing grid can be flipped 180 degrees on your turn so you can start filling up from the bottom (top). The pieces already in the grid remain in the locations and don't slide down.
30836.name: Connect 4 Flip

30837.name: Crime Busters: Space Precinct
30837.description:
Gerry Anderson's Space Precinct Crime Busters Board Game!

Each player is issued with a case to solve. By moving around Demeter City in their Police Cruisers players must gather evidence and locate and apprehend their suspect.

Players move by spinner or communication cards. Players move to relevant crime scenes to collect evidence. Once the player has collected four evidence tokens (including the three specific ones for their case they can attempt to apprehend the suspect.

To apprehend the player trades unwanted evidence to look at a suspect card.

Once apprehend then its back to the Station to win the game

30838.name: Les 7 Blasons
30838.description:
This is a game of tactics and counter-attacks during which you will seize any opportunity to take tricks and get blazons other than yours. Each player plays for his/her own self but alliances may be useful and are sometimes more than welcome. But beware of traitors!

The goal of the game is to score as many points as possible by taking tricks and collecting blazons other than yours. You will score points for the tricks you get and the blazons placed in front of you, but remember that the only blazons from which you can get points should be face up and different from your own blazon!!!

Game contents:


56 playing cards: 8 per blazon, each representing a character (mischievous, peasant, fiddler, magistrate, friar, intendant, middle-class woman and middle-class man); some characters have special powers. Card values range from 0 to 7;
7 “blazon cards” used for player identification and scoring points;
28 “blazon tokens” (4 tokens per blazon);
1 booklet including game rules;
11 additional cards, for game variants: 4 “middle-class” cards (lower, average, upper, higher), and 7 other “friar” playing cards (with special powers).

30839.name: Pirelli Rallye Monte Carlo
30839.description:
The Pirelli Rallye Monte Carlo game represents a rally race with the board representing a Leg that consists of four road sections and three special stages. The object is to be the fastest over three legs or three runs over the entire track. In the 1980's the sport was a bit different. Road sections were over public streets and going too fast or too slow garnered a time penalty. The Special stages were over closed public roads, private roads or trails in rural areas and speed was not restricted. In the game, the Road sections have a set number of dice throws in which a player is to travel the section with his car. You may roll one or two D6 that have numbers 1,2 or 3 on the faces. Finishing in less rolls garners a 10 second penalty and finishing in too many rolls gets a 5 second penalty. For each special stage, a card is drawn with details of that stage and players must try and choose the best tyres for that stage, with weather conditions being a contributing factor. Then an Unexpected Weather condition card is drawn. The tire choice combined with info from the two cards modify the die rolls during the Special stage. The player then chooses to roll the red die that has more pips and two crash faces or the blue die with less pips and only one crash face. Along the Special stages are spaces that result in car damage if a player lands on those spaces. Prior to starting the race each player may place Repair Stations along the Road sections to repair damages incurred along the Specials stages. If a player lands on a Damage space in the first Special stage, that Damage penalty, 10 seconds, will be applied thereafter to each section until the player meets the requirement for entering one of his Repair Stations. The player who completes the three Legs in the fastest time wins the rally/game.

Basically a roll and move game with a bit of flare within the theme of the sport as it was conducted at the time of the game's production.

This being a game for the Pirelli tire company, there is more information concerning tires in the game materials than is necessary to play the game. The only tyres available are from Pirelli and the game materials seek to show how each tyre should be used, with the rulebook containing a lot of information about how rallies were organized and run at that time and how to choose tyres for each stage.

30840.name: Noodles!
30840.description:
Adaptation of the comic strips series published by Soleil, designed by Severine Gauthier, Thomas Labourot and Christian Lerolle, "Extraordinary Adventures: Noodles!" propose you to live the history of Kikitte, Isha, Peko and Mayoke.
Discover the magic universe of Noodles! by achieving the quest which your Sentetsu Master entrusted to you. Martial arts, special abilities and various weapons, you have in hand the keys to success.

Mix of boardgame, card game and role playing game, Noodles! make it possible to play alone or to gather five players around a great adventure rythmed by all kinds of tests, enigmas, searches and fights.

Difficulty level can be adapted and the course of the play can be modified by choosing different options included in the game rules.

Ready to fight Doragon dragon and the terrible lady of snows? Then on the way for the adventure!

30841.name: Nav-O-Strat
30841.description:
Board game of naval/air warfare with capture of islands/bases.

Game features perhaps one of the largest boxes in the history of game publishing--24 1/4 inches by 18 1/4 inches by one-and-a-half inches. The hard-mounted board is twice this size. The single combat chart is the size of the box.

The box top features a reproduction of a hand-drawn charcoal-pencil picture of an aircraft carrier flight deck and island with crewmen on deck, with ships and planes in the background along with yellow-and-red shell bursts, muzzle flashes and black smoke plume.

Rules are contained in a single-folded 8 1/2 inch by 11 inch sheet.

Components include Board, Battle Chart, twenty cards (numbered from One to Ten), two dice and two fleets of miniature vac-u-formed ships in red and blue, plus eight injection-molded miniature 105 mm guns in silver.

Board is a grid of one-inch white-outlined squares on a blue sea. Along one side of the board is a display for each carrier deck plus a Dry Dock and Shipyard display for each player.

Along each baseline is a Home Base and Airfield. A sixteen-square island with an Airfield and four fort zones occupies the center of each half of the game board.

Each Fleet consists of two Aircraft Carriers, 3 Battleships, 4 Landing Barges, 5 Planes, 2 Cruisers, 2 Destroyers, and 4 Submarines.

The "Battle Chart" has 26 columns, one for each possible attacker/defender type combination, plus a column for "Units of equal strength." Ten results are provided for each column including outcomes such as Sunk, Damaged, Return to Shipyard, Retreats, Escapes, and more.

Victory is achieved by either sinking the enemy Fleet or capturing the enemy's Island Base.

Toomey Toys was located in Harrisburg, PA.

30842.name: A Journey round the World
30842.description: This early and simple game was made by a company in Bavaria for English-speaking countries.

30843.name: Dark Age Infantry Slog
30843.description:
Miniature wargame rules for the Dark Ages up through Norman Conquest. Originally published in "Miniature Wargames" Magazine, No. 7, 1983. Referred to on occasion as "D.A.I.S" or "The D.A.I.S. System."

Made available through Wyre Forest Games Club as a free download:

http://www.wfgamers.org.uk/resources/callan/dais.htm

The game strives to capture the "feel" of the period using two or three "divisions" or "battles" of grouped warrior bands of Retinues and Contingents, rather than a number of independently-maneuvering "units" of like-armed soldiers.

The qualities of Aggression, Formation and Strength are key along with Leadership which seeks to maximize these qualities to gain advantage over opposing troops. These qualities ebb and flow depending on the fortunes of the unit, nearby friendly units, and Leaders.

The actual resolution of combat is literally resolved by each player engaging in a single round of rock/paper/scissors for each pair of units, or aligned groups of soldiers from a unit, brought together in melee.

30844.name: Parasite!
30844.description:
A simple set of aliens-vs-humans skirmish combat rules inspired by films such as "Aliens." Three pages of rules plus diagram of an installations for initial scenario.

Rules for alien encounters, firing, "mortal combat" (melee), wounds, noncombatants, aliens' ability to use captured weapons.

30845.name: Run the Guns
30845.description:
Miniature wargame rules for naval actions in the American Civil War, intended for 15mm scale figures and miniature ships but also usable with 10mm and, with some record keeping, 1/600 or smaller ship miniatures (with player-provided movement/range conversions).

Rules cover armored vessels, steam and wind-powered ships, submarines, ramming, ship vs. fortification, and boarding actions. Leadership, crew quality, various weight of guns, damage control, grounding, fires, about 14 pages of rules and a two-sided removable card with game tables.

30846.name: Cavalier & Roundhead
30846.description:
Fast-play English Civil War miniatures rules, scaled for 15 - 28mm figures with provision for measurement conversion to 5, 6 or 10mm scales.

Seven pages of rules, two pages of charts. Three types of infantry, three types of cavalry, light and heavy guns differentiated along with five possible troop qualities from Rabble to Arrogant.

30847.name: Landsknecht & Reiter
30847.description:
Battalion/Regiment scale miniature Renaissance-era wargame, designed for fast play. Eight pages of rules, two pages of charts.

Scaled for 15-28mm miniatures with provision for 5, 6 or 10mm with measurement conversion. Four types of infantry, four types of cavalry, light and heavy guns represented.

30848.name: Vectis
30848.description:
A boardgame allowing two players to fight out a fictional campaign from the Napoleonic Wars: a French invasion of England's Isle of Wight. Full rules are provided, with period illustrations and fictional vignettes conveying the feel of the game setting. Provided with the cut-outs needed to make the four-part A2 board and 93 playing counters. A game should last 90 minutes on a first play, reducing to an hour once familiar with the rules.

The PDF version can be found at:
http://www.wargamedownloads.com/item.php?item=577

30849.name: Granopoly
30849.description:
Monopoly themed around the Village of Granville, Ohio to celebrate the Granville Bicentennial. Features many of the historic locations and businesses around the community.

The classic boardgame was inspired by Sam Kapland-Goland, created by Mrs. Jeanna Giovannell's 4th Grade Discovery Class of the Granville Intermediate School. This version of Monopoly requires players to accumulate wealth by acquiring businesses while avoiding charges for the customers. Community Chest and Chance cards are replaced by Fate and Bicentenial Chest cards. The In Court and Loading Zones spaces replace the Free Parking and Jail spaces. A must for Ohio history fans.

30850.name: Microwars V-1.0
30850.description:
Drakons and Gödenors fight for the conquer of space. Due to a the simultaneous explosion of several stars, the universe collides in only one dimension.

Drakons are oviparous and enormous. They gather in developed communities, with high technology. Their strength and aggressiveness is remarkable.

Gödenors haven't a special natural strength but a high level of intelligence, becoming one of the most dangerous races in the world.

Both races have met, unfortunately, and so have created two forces that will fight to the death for the control of the new world, to conquer a new place to live and improve.

Drakon's force is commanded by Clain, the Manan, and is composed by two Dux-Manan and Atter-Manan, Arnor and Cowtor which have in charge three expert Mereos: Sunno, Cornex and Artak. Gödenors have the same forces in their side: Arco(Manan), Daro(Dux-Manan), Rotx(Atter-Manan) and the Mereos(Sazzer, Preto y Malk).

The goal of the game is to conquer the opposite military base. It's achieved by getting one the characters to the mountainous enemy base.

Each of the characters have different attributes that can be used in combat against enemy creatures.

Each player starts with only the Manan and will get through the different places by throwing a dice. Your forces could be increased by gathering new soldiers and getting additional powers, all of these using cards, supplied in Oracle squares. Other special squares will grant you access to mountains (Climbing) or get you frozen (Dimensional Door).

To stop enemy forces in their advance to your base, you can attack them with your ground forces, by placing them adjacent or by using the heavy artillery placed in mountains. Artillery will give you the opportunity to fire one of the missiles, trying to knock down opposing forces.

There are additional powers attained through extra cards.

boardgameimplementation: Star Wars: Episode 1 – Clash of the Lightsabers
30852.description:
Choose which Transformer army you’ll align with – Megatron or Optimus Prime - and challenge your opponent in a head-to-head duel for control of the AllSpark. Use your cards carefully and crush your competitor, or else you’ll be forced to face defeat. Includes beginner and advanced gameplay rules!

Re-Implements:

Star Wars: Episode 1 - Clash of the Lightsabers




Re-Implemented by:

Iron Man Battling Card Game
Iron Man 2: Game of War
30852.name: Transformers Battling Card Game

30853.name: Shrek 3-D Memory Match-Up
30853.description:
From the Instructions:

"Test your memory with Shrek and all his twisted fairytale friends! Just turn over the cups to find half a fairytale character, then see if you can find the other half!"

30854.name: Super Force Seven
30854.description:
Super Force Seven (SF7) is a Tactical RPG / Miniatures Adventure Wargame allowing for battles between super powered characters of all kinds. The game can be played as a typical tactical miniatures game, but really shines when the options for added depth are used, allowing it to be played more like a light-RPG or a campaign/story driven tactical miniatures game.

Game play is fast paced and simple, and the well thought out design system allows you to easily build your favorite characters from comic books, television, the movies or from your own imagination and lets you pit these characters against each other in a variety of scenarios. These scenarios can range from a simple brawl in the streets to a battle of wits between two masterminds, or anything else you can think of, making this much more than just another game of superhero combat.
